entry.title: A mental math heuristic to convert between Fahrenheit and Celsius | Evan Hahn (dot com)
entry.summary: I sometimes have to convert between Fahrenheit and Celsius. The actual formula is hard to do in my head, but someone once told me a useful approximation:To convert from Celsius to Fahrenheit, double i
entry.content: I sometimes have to convert between Fahrenheit and Celsius. The actual formula is hard to do in my head, but someone once told me a useful approximation:To convert from Celsius to Fahrenheit, double it and add 30.To convert from Fahrenheit to Celsius, subtract 30 and halve it (the reverse).For example, if it’s 12ºC, this heuristic would return 54ºF. (12 × 2) + 30 = 54. The actual amount is not far off: 53.6ºF.To convert the other way: 68ºF becomes 19ºC. (68 − 30) ÷ 2 = 19. Again, this is close t

entry.summary: It’s easy to see how SaaS sprawl happens if you picture the moment it starts. A team is blocked, someone needs a tool ASAP, and the answer to their problems lies just behind a free trial, so they sign
entry.content: It’s easy to see how SaaS sprawl happens if you picture the moment it starts. A team is blocked, someone needs a tool ASAP, and the answer to their problems lies just behind a free trial, so they sign up for a new tool. No one is being careless. They’re being efficient. entry.content: From Chrome 145 onwards, 100vw will automatically subtract the size of the (vertical) scrollbar from it if you have forced the html element to always show a vertical scrollbar (using overflow[-y]: scroll) or if you reserve space for it (using scrollbar-gutter: stable). The same applies to vh with a horizontal scrollbar, as well as all small, large, and dynamic variants.
